instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
Hi everyone.
Somewhat stumped on an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board.
Laptop came in with some general signs of liquid damage, I reflowed some of the worse looking areas with flux to clean them, then ran board through the ultrasonic.
Now the laptop powers on fine with my power supply, but on official magsafe, the green light comes on for 1 second, then turns off and the computer does not boot.
Would appreciate some help if anyone has had this issue before

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message: I would check the dc in flex, also your official magsafe pins.

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
Have checked my dc board, flex and charger, same combo gets green light on a different 3437 board.
<DIODE>D7012</DIODE> looks good on visual inspection.
Have tried replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> but get the same behaviour. I think you're onto something regarding the leakage, because the official charger is protecting itself by lowering dcin voltage

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
"<DIODE>D7012</DIODE> looks good on visual inspection."
I will also like to have an eye which inspect in diode mode...

Post exact values for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86; measured onboard, ohm scale.

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
haha, sorry about that, I should've checked the diode. It measures 0.78v one way and OL the other on diode mode

<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> is 67.6k
<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 is 100k and 62.1k respectively
<RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 is 0.468M and 0.333M respectively.
They all seem to be the right value according to the schematic

Thank you for taking the time to help

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages.
Check if board starts disconnecting LIO flex; no Magsafe light present then.

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
weirdly the board has now decided to work with the magsafe, even though it wasn't working last night after changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.
I'm going to put it back in the laptop and run a few tests.
Any idea what the problem might've been?

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
so...
Overall the board seems to boot into the os fine and mostly works, but for some reason it tells me no serial number is available, which stops me from running the built-in diagnostics.
Should I dump the bios or is the problem somewhere else?

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
That is BIOS issue.
Easy to solve with Medusa programmer.
If you don't have it, then upload original BIOS somewhere along with serial number needed to put in.

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
yes, sorry, I don't have a medusa yet. No wonder there's no serial, I opened the bios dump in hex and there's no FSYS region.
I had a go at editing a clean me 3437 file using instructions from the forum, and I got the serial to show right and the usual things like webcam work fine, but still if you could fix the original dump with the medusa I'd appreciate it.
here's the link: [URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=1o_so4vb7c0OVQUJObyZCpD4ziyLzB-YP"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1o_...ZCpD4ziyLzB-YP[/URL]
the serial on the casing is C02M55X1F5V8

Could I also get you to help me with another 3437 bios at the same time? This one wasn't booting before, but now it boots fine with a clean me bios. If you could transfer the serial from the bad bios to the clean one that would be awesome, they're both in this folder:
[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=1XnDp_BR0AWMiBDe1aTnggcuEh6DjDhj0"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Xn...nggcuEh6DjDhj0[/URL]

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:

[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=1-xRnhJQzXxZXTZnUXYD_sW32_LL5VD7z"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1-x...D_sW32_LL5VD7z[/URL]
Let me know if good.
?Bafta!

The second board didn't start at all with original backup, or got stuck in the progress bar?

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
Try this one for second board.
[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=1FGRauPq83xoqTOQGVk-k1UoKjX_ePnsy"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1FG...-k1UoKjX_ePnsy[/URL]

threads.title: 82-3437 Green light goes off
threads.message:
The second one came in very dirty, after ultrasonic it would get fan spin, vcore, but no picture, no usb activity, no brain.

Both the bioses worked perfectly. Thank you very much as always
